item.title: Consistent fly tipping by 219 Ilderton Road, 5th December
item.description:
Getting really fed up but keep seeing repeated general waste dumped outside 219 Ilderton overspilling unto 221 and across the pavement into the street. have seen rats and foxes attracted by the rubbish. You need to deal with this immediately and deal with the occupants at 219 as they are causing a serious health hazard. You also need to consider a different solution for waste disposal: they are simply not enough green bins!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ilderton Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree blocking highway, 5th December
item.description:
An extremely large branch is blocking 1.5 lanes of the highway making it difficult to cross the round about and potentially very dangerous. The highway is blocked going down the hill which means there is no safe walking route on this side for pedestrians. With nearly zebra crossings on this road people pushing prams/ using wheelchairs need to have clear assess.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crofton Lane, Crofton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose air condition units on roof, 5th December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Petherton Road, Hackney, London

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dallas Road, Forest Hill, Greater London

item.title: Corner Sarre and Minster Roads, east s ude, 5th December
item.description:
Paving stones have been pushed up by tree roots and are a danger to pedestrians. The repairs (photos previously submitted) are absolutely shoddy, what is needed is for the stones to be relaid. This is the second time a very inadequate job has been made to solve the problem. Whoever is responsible for choosing trees should be advised to select trees with roots that go down deep, and not those trees with roots that extend across the surface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Minster Road, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Especially near bus stop zebra crossings and Albany street generally, 5th December
item.description:
There are ‘no overtaking’ road signs at all but this happens a lot as drivers drive at very high speed anyway ignoring the 20mph sign especially at the zebra crossings on Albany Street near Cumberland Terrace bus stop and is a significant safety issue as pedestrians are given way to cross but the cars driving at speed from behind overtake even though people are crossing including elderly, children and people with dogs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albany Street, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request for grit / salt box, 5th December
item.description:
Please can we request a grit / salt box to be installed at the top of the cul de sac / parking area. This area is not gritted and the stairs are incredibly slippery in the ice and there are a number of young family’s. There is a grit box further down Beddington Road but this is broken and far from the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beddington Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bicycle Lane paving material not safe in cold icy conditions, 5th December
item.description:
The newer bike lanes at this junction have various different surface materials. One of the surface materials that has been used is completely inappropriate and unsafe in frosty/icy conditions. Under these conditions it becomes incredibly slippery, almost ice rink like, and results in many cyclists falling off their bikes. The surfaces need to be reconsidered and replaced with something far safer and more suitable to the large numbers of bikes that use this area, especially many parents with children on their bikes. On 05/12/2025 this was a serious problem and no salt or grit had been spread by the council either. Myself and another cyclist, along with a caretaker from the nearby school had to cover the entire area ourselves to prevent further injury, after 10s of cyclists had fallen. Please address this urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Lane, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Completely blocked and covered gulley drain outside 65 Southend Crescent, 5th December
item.description:
We have just moved in so don’t know how long this has been a problem. This is outside our house - blocked drain and completely covered meaning water cannot enter and instead is draining down the hill and running into the path and into our driveway towards the house causing water damage.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Footscray Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet
